name: Clay
description: Provides a bridge to Clay's personal CRM platform for searching, retrieving, and managing contact information,...

capabilities: **Detailed Contact Info**: Access comprehensive information for a specific contact by ID.
**Interaction Search**: Retrieve past interactions based on various criteria.
**Add New Contact**: Create new contacts with details like name, phone, email, and more.
**Create New Group**: Create a new group or list.
**Retrieve Groups**: Get all user-defined groups or lists.
**Add Contact Note**: Create a note associated with a specific contact.
**Update Group**: Update a group's title or modify its members.
**Retrieve Events**: Fetch meetings and events scheduled within a specified date range.
**Contact Search**: Find contacts by job title, company, location, or specific keywords.
**Contact Statistics**: Obtain numerical statistics and percentages related to your contacts.
**Retrieve Notes**: Get notes created within a specified date range.
metadata.readme_excerpt: # Clay MCP Server A simple Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for [Clay](https://clay.earth). ## Demo Video ## Getting Started ### Via Smithery (fastest) [![smithery badge](https://smithery.ai/badge/@clay-inc/clay-mcp)](https://smithery.ai/server/@clay-inc/clay-mcp) 1. [Click here to log into Clay and generate your Clay API key](https://web.clay.earth/settings/api-keys). 2. [Visit Clay's Smithery page](https://smithery.ai/server/@clay-inc/clay-mcp) and enter your Clay API key under "Installation". 3. Under Claude > NPM, copy the NPM command and run it in your terminal. ### Manual installation 1. Edit your `claude_desktop_config.json` (in the Claude Desktop app, go to Preferences > Developer > Edit Config) 2.
